modules.description: Formats color values for output, parses string representations into color objects, and supports custom pretty-printing. Works with an abstract type representing color data. Used to convert user input strings into internal color structures for rendering or processing.

Provides functions to generate formatted output, calculate string widths, sanitize input, and create accessible text. Works with strings, floats, references, and custom types like Color and Style. Used to display status messages with optional styling, icons, and counters in terminal interfaces.

Parses and formats icon data, converting between string representations and structured tuples of optional strings and floating-point coordinates. Operates on string-based data and produces formatted output for display. Used to render icons with specific positioning in graphical interfaces.

Checks if a value is absent, returning true when the input is None. Operates on the option type, which represents values that may be missing. Used to safely handle cases where a computation might not produce a result, such as looking up a key in a dictionary that may not exist.

Converts a string representation of a style into a structured type, supporting parsing of visual attributes. Works with a custom type that encapsulates style properties such as color, font, and spacing. Used to apply consistent styling in UI components based on predefined string configurations.

Provides access to a precomputed table of float values representing a specific mathematical transformation. Operates on raw float arrays and returns lookup results based on input indices. Used to accelerate rendering of graphical elements requiring rapid access to preprocessed data.

Generates SVG badges with customizable text, color, and layout using string and color parameters. Processes badge configurations into rendered SVG elements. Used to create project status indicators, version badges, and build status visuals.

Encapsulates utilities for handling color, style, and icon data, along with input validation and formatting. It manages abstract types for colors and styles, processes string inputs into structured representations, and supports formatted output with optional styling. It includes functions to check for missing values, calculate string dimensions, and retrieve precomputed float data for rendering. Examples include converting color names to internal objects, generating styled status messages, and rendering icons with precise positioning.
